text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .

here 's a summary of where things stand : public support crumbled for iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki on tuesday as the government of iran and multiple iraqi shia militias announced their support for prime minister-designate haider al-abadi , who also won a pledge of support from the iraqi kurds .
the timeline and mechanism of maliki 's exit and whether he would go easily were unclear .
he did not make a public statement on tuesday .
the united states held out the promise of further economic and military aid if abadi formed an inclusive government quickly .
the humanitarian disaster in the sinjar mountains in northern iraq continued to claim lives , with 20,000-30,000 people who fled the advance of isis fighters still trapped on the mountain .
read more here .
the pentagon is considering sending additional military advisers to iraq , a senior defense official said .
the us is flying up to 100 sorties a day in iraq and using drones to hit isis positions .
the european union agreed that individual members could send arms to iraqi kurds , in coordination with baghdad .
two car bombs killed 12 people in different parts of the iraqi capital baghdad on tuesday , police sources said .

documents.title: more than 1.2m displaced in iraq , un says
text: as many as 35,000 people have fled sinjar mountain through syria to return to iraqi kurdistan and seek shelter in the dohuk governorate , unhcr spokesperson adrian edwards said at a press briefing in geneva tuesday .
edwards said in a statement : people are moving to places including zakho and dohuk town where 16 school buildings have been made available .
food , water and medical care are being provided .
as of now , an estimated 20,000 to 30,000 people remain trapped on sinjar mountain without food , water or shelter .
access to these families is extremely limited .

dohuk governorate is now hosting close to 400,000 displaced iraqis , including yazidis , christians , shabak , kakai , armenian and turkmen minorities some of whom have endured repeated displacement .
[ ] in all , there are more than 1.2 million internally displaced people in iraq , including an estimated 700,000 in the kurdistan region which already hosts some 220,000 syrian refugees .

documents.title: eu agrees members can arm kurds
text: the european union failed on tuesday to agree on a joint position on supplying weapons to iraqi kurds battling islamic state militants , but said individual members could send arms in coordination with baghdad , reuters reports : eu ambassadors , holding an extraordinary meeting to discuss the crises in iraq , ukraine and gaza , gave the green light for individual governments to send arms under set conditions .

the ( ambassadors ) noted the urgent request by the kurdish regional authorities to certain member states for military support and underlined the need to consider this request in close coordination with the iraqi authorities , a spokesman for eu foreign policy chief catherine ashton said .

the guardian 's mona mahmood ( @ monamood ) has spoken by phone with khaoula hassan , a mother of 10 who fled with her family into the sinjar mountains nine days ago , to escape islamic state fighters .

i do not want anything for myself but need urgent help for my ten kids especially a two month infant who is dying slowly in my hands , hassan tells mona : i forgot entirely to grab her infant formula while we were fleeing our home , in fear of the fighters .
our main concern was to protect our kids , nothing else .
all that we brought with us to the mountain was a few blankets .
the mountain is hot during the day and cold at night .
we have been on the mountain for nine days now .
even my breast is getting dry to feed my little baby .
i 'm frantically worried about her safety , watching her heath waning rapidly within the last two days .
she is losing weight for the shortage of food and dehydration .
there is no medical assistance on the mountain at all .
i 'm so terrified about her , though i have to say that there are tens of infants who are dying on the mountain for the same reasons every day .
[ ] hassan said she saw a us plane near the mountain tuesday and her husband ran to get some food .
he brought some juice , biscuit , tomato , cucumber and wheat , hassan said : we found a tanker of rain water on the mountain that is used by the shepherds to water the sheep and trees .
we relied on all the time for drinking and making bread .

the only way to escape the hardship of the mountain is to walk for an entire day down the mountain till you get to a peshemrga checkpoint that would move you by cars to syrian borders and then to dahouk or zakhou provinces in kurdistan .
my sisters and brothers were able to get to kurdistran that way , but i could not with my kids .
we are dying slowly here .
jonathan rugman of channel 4 has been reporting on the yazidi plight .
jonathan rugman ( @ jrug ) i just checked my notes .
suleyman says he saw 33 unburied dead on sinjar mountain & buried 2 himself :
the helicopter that crashed delivering aid in the sinjar mountains , killing the pilot , major general majid ashour , ended up on its side .
click through to see a photograph of the wreckage by photographer moises saman ( and see more of his arresting images of iraq on the new yorker web site ) .

dan stewart ( @ thatdanstewart ) first photo from the iraqi helicopter crash , taken by time photographer who survived it jonathan rugman ( @ jrug ) maj gen majid ashour killed in helicopter crash delivering yazidi aid .
he flew us yesterday .
brave man rescuing his fellow iraqis .

australian prime minister tony abbott has declined to rule out military involvement in northern iraq , saying he was not prepared to stand aside in the face of a potential genocide , the guardian 's josh halliday ( @ joshhalliday ) reports : speaking after a day of high-level intelligence briefings with british officials in london , abbott described the unfolding atrocity in northern iraq as a humanitarian catastrophe and said australia would provide humanitarian aid to yazidi refugees besieged by islamic state ( isis ) forces on mount sinjar in northern iraq .
abbott said : as president obama has said , it is a potential genocide and no one wants to stand aside in the face of a potential genocide .
asked in a press conference in central london whether he would rule out australian military involvement in the deepening crisis , the liberal leader said : we certainly do n't rule that out .
read the full piece here .

britain has a moral and historical obligation to arm the kurds against the islamic state jihadists now menacing irbil , and failure to so would be certain to amplify the terror threat at home , the kurdish security chief , masrour barazani , told the guardian 's martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) on tuesday .

martin reports in irbil : in an interview with the guardian , barazani , chancellor of the kurdistan region security council , has implored the british public not to allow fatigue from more than 10 years of war to stop support for the kurds in what is fast shaping up to be the biggest threat to iraqi kurdish society since the collapse of the ottoman empire almost 100 years ago .
he said : in terms of drawing the lines [ the regional borders ] , the uk had the greatest role in the creation of the modern middle east .
now is not the time to say it is not our problem .
i would like britain to remember that we are not helmand , or basra , we are your friends .

mentioning the british-french agreement that enshrined the modern states of lebanon and syria , and led to the creation of iraq 's borders , he added : for how long do the kurds have to pay the price of the mistakes that were made ?
we are victims of sykes picot .
for how long do we have to be held hostage , or to be vulnerable ?
read the full piece here .

islamic state fighters have caused kurdish officials to question whether the reputation of some peshmerga units is built on past glories rather than current capabilities , the guardian 's martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) writes in irbil : to the kurds of iraq 's north , the sight of their vaunted peshmerga troops in full retreat nine days ago was difficult to reconcile .
for decades the peshmerga had been the force they could depend on to keep their territory safe and keep alive their dreams of autonomy .

but in one humiliating weekend , the kurdish forces were chased back to irbil by an enemy that has now turned its attention and guns on everything the kurds have built during decades of war with saddam hussein , then the us-led invasion , and eight years of enmity with iraq 's central government , when many in the north turned inwards and quietly got rich .
read the full piece here .

he says the plight of the yazidi people , of which thousands are still trapped in the sinjar mountains , is harrowing with accounts of executions , child abductions and exploitation at the hands of isis militants
a map of us strikes around the sinjar mountains , via a washington post graphics editor .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : no significant public ally was apparent for iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki in his bid to retain office .
maliki himself did not make a public statement tuesday .
iran pledged support to the nominee for iraqi prime minister , haider al-abadi , as did the united states , nato , saudi arabia , shia militias in iraq and much of parliament .
the us and nato called for the swift formation of an inclusive government under abadi .
the us offered more aid as an incentive .
a senior us defense official said the pentagon was considering sending more military advisers to iraq .
rescue efforts continued on behalf of thousands of members of the yazidi religious minority stranded in northern mountains .
one rescue helicopter crashed , killing the pilot .
jets were en route from britain to assist with surveillance and aid .
two car bombs killed 12 people in different parts of the iraqi capital baghdad on tuesday , police sources said .
in this wednesday , feb. 27 , 2013 , file photo , iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki listens to a question during an interview with the associated press in baghdad .
mohammed/ap

in a last-ditch attempt to remain in office , said-to-be-outgoing iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki sent an envoy last week to basra to seek the support of the grand ayatollah ali al-sistani only to be turned down , reuters ' michael georgy reports : maliki calculated he may have one more chance to hold onto power after eight years in office , even though alarmed allies had run out of patience as islamic state jihadis swept government forces aside in much of western and northern iraq .

maliki 's plan would require persuading iraq 's most influential cleric that he alone could reform and unite a country that had slid back into a civil war fueled by what critics view as his sectarian politics .

a week ago , he sent a delegation from his islamic dawa party to try to meet grand ayatollah ali al-sistani in the sacred shi'ite city of najaf , south of baghdad , according to an iraqi minister and a source close to the clergy .

it was unclear if they succeeded in gaining an audience with the reclusive 83-year-old cleric , but they did get a response on paper , if not the one that maliki was hoping for : sistani made it clear that he wanted change .
he put it in writing - the first time that a leader of iraq 's shi'ite clergy did such a thing , the minister told reuters .

the tornado jets that the british government said yesterday it was sending to iraq for surveillance and humanitarian aid missions have left their royal air force base in norfolk and are en route to cyprus to be placed on standby , the uk defense ministry said .
guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) reports : as needed , they will accompany uk c-130 cargo planes ferrying the food , water and medicine drops .
thousands of innocent people suffering in northern iraq urgently need our help , said new uk defense secretary michael fallon .
tornado aircraft will be able to play a specialist surveillance role to give us a more complete of the situation in the crisis area .
i also want to express my gratitude to the aircrews and supporting personnel who have delivered three significant aid drops already and will continue to do so .
us president barack obama spoke by phone on tuesday with turkish prime minister recep tayyip erdogan about the situation in iraq and syria .
obama also congratulated erdogan on becoming turkey 's first directly elected president .
the ap reports : obama also spoke with canadian prime minister stephen harper .
the white house says the two leaders agreed to work with other partners in the international community to provide immediate humanitarian assistance to civilians in iraq .
obama made the calls from martha 's vineyard , the massachusetts island where he 's spending two weeks on vacation .

us state department spokesperson marie harf says support for abadi is fairly clear : spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) `` support for the prime minister-designate has i think been fairly clear , '' - @ twitterid , noting maliki telling military keep out of politics

un secretary-general ban ki-moon said it 's imperative that iraqi security forces stay out of the political process leading to the formation of a new government , ap reports : ban criticized leaders in iraq and many other places for failing to promote an inclusive society , allowing groups including the islamic state to take root .
the u.n. chief said the poison of hatred and brutality has been allowed to spread in iraq , syria and the region .
he spoke at a news conference tuesday .

a senior us defense official says the pentagon is considering sending more military advisers to iraq , the ap reports : their role would be to help determine future course of action for the u.s. , based in part on the impact of several days of targeted airstrikes on the islamic extremist fighters and how that has affected kurdish forces opposing them in northern iraq .
the defense official spoke on condition of anonymity because no decisions about expanding the adviser team have been made .
the pentagon already has 250 military personnel in iraq in advisory roles .
about 90 are studying the strength of the islamic state militant group 's fighters and the iraqi government forces , and another 160 are advising iraqi forces on military operations .
the guardian 's mona mahmood ( @ monamood ) has spoken by telephone with rasheed baha , 24 , a father of two from sinjar now stranded on sinjar mountain .
my parents were in panic to drive me out of sight when the isis fighters rampaged sinjar town ten days ago , baha tells mona .

he ran into the mountains and became separated from his family : i got settled under a grove of figs trees on the mountain , doing nothing but calling my family over and over again , however , there was no answer at all two days ago , out of the blue , my wife was on the mobile speaking to me .
her voice was faltering and shaky and hard to up .
she was in a hectic rush to pass a few words to me .
it was a colossal shock that wrecked havoc on me when she said in a sobbing voice that she and all other members of my family were locked up by isis in badoush prison in mosul .
my wife hurriedly added that she got a mobile secretly from one of the jailers in the prison just to let me know that they were still alive but shockingly in jail .
i ca n't deny that i was ravaged by mixed feelings of joy and grief altogether .
but when i look around i found myself trapped at the mountain for nine days now and there is no imminent sign that i will be out of here soon .
my wife said that the jailers are giving the kids some milk and the adults getting a meal per a day .
iraqi yezidi refugees escaping from attacks of islamic state , wait in line to receive food in sirnak city of turkey on august 12 , 2014 .

agency/getty images the us aid dropped on the mountain is not enough for the people there , baha says : the planes come every day to drop a ton of wheat , you are lucky if you could get a bag to bake on fire and get some bread .
they dropped water and few tents as well five days ago .
there was a drop of milk bags once , but we did not see any more after .
it is too hard to catch an item of the aid as people gathered in big crowd when they see the plane hovering above their heads .
they all compete to get their share .
there are few sheep on the mountain , we slaughtered them and cooked meals for the starving families and were able to get some water from the scattered fountains on the mountain .
maliki becomes the outgoing prime minister on iraqi tv , iraq analyst sajad jiyad tweets : sajad jiyad ø³ø¬ø§ø¯ ( @ sajadjiyad ) iraqiya tv now referring to maliki as the outgoing pm

congress is fine with the new us military engagement in iraq which currently involves up to 100 air sorties a day , the shipment of light arms and ammunition to the kurds , military advisers in baghdad , intelligence sharing , and the promise of more support if abadi forms an inclusive government ( but no boots on the ground , the secretary of state says ) the associated press reports : little of the impassioned debate that fractured lawmakers a year ago over possible military intervention in syria is happening now as american war planes strike extremist targets in iraq .

almost a week into it , the obama administration 's emergency military action against islamic state sunni insurgents in northern iraq is attracting surprisingly broad bipartisan support from congress .
republicans have issued i-told-you-so statements and called for stronger action .
dovish democrats have voiced concerns about slipping into a new war .
but outright opposition has been muted .

the guardian 's saeed kamali dehghan : saeed kamali dehghan ( @ saeedkd ) after earlier comments by a senior official , iran 's foreign ministry too congratulates # iraq on the appointment of new pm , al-abadi - tasnim
not jimmy carter .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : support crumbled on all sides for iraqi prime minister nouri al-maliki , whose presumed replacement , haider al-abadi , was named monday .
iran publicly expressed support on tuesday for abadi , as did iraqi kurdish leader massoud barzani , badr organization leader hadi ameri , saudi arabia and the american leadership .
the us and nato called for the swift formation of an inclusive government under abadi .
the us offered more aid as an incentive .
maliki 's next move was unclear .
in a brief statement on his website , he called for security personnel to stay away from the political crisis and carry out their duties in protecting the country .
a un panel warned of potential genocide against the yazidi people stranded in the mountains around the northern city of sinjar .
one helicopter ferrying aid to the yazidis crashed , apparently without coming under attack .
the vatican called on muslim leaders to condemn persecution of christians and yazidis by fighters under the banner of an islamic state .
egypt 's grand mufti condemned the is as a danger to islam .
a us drone struck an isis mortar position .
the us is flying as many as 100 sorties over iraq each day .
us secretary of state john kerry said there would be no us boots on the ground .
two car bombs killed 12 people in different parts of the iraqi capital baghdad on tuesday , police sources said .

saudi arabia joins nato , tehran , washington , the kurds , the badr organization ahmed al omran ( @ ahmed ) saudi arabia welcomes the nomination of haider al-abadi as iraq pm in congratulation cable sent from king abdullah

the crash of a helicopter carrying aid to stranded yazidis has killed the pilot and wounded passengers , including a new york times journalist , the paper reports : alissa j. rubin , 56 , the times 's paris bureau chief and a longtime war correspondent , suffered an apparent concussion and broken wrists but was conscious , she confirmed when contacted briefly by cell phone .
adam ferguson , 35 , a freelance photogapher working for the times who was accompanying her , said via cell phone that he was not injured .

[ ] the kurdish official attributed the crash to an accident but the precise cause was not immediately clear there was no evidence that sunni extremists who have besieged the yazidis in the area were anywhere nearby read the full report here .
also reportedly aboard was iraqi yazidi lawmaker vian dakhil , a key voice in parliament calling for aid for the yazidis .
she is said to be ok [ see update below ] : niqash ( @ niqash ) confirming : her political party says mp vian dakhil is apparently ok after rescue helicopter crash near sinjar .

update : dakhil was injured in the crash , according to a government spokesman , via reuters : a yazidi member of parliament , vian dakheel , was among those injured , the prime minister 's military spokesman , qassim atta , told a televised news conference .

during a parliament session this month , dakheel broke into tears describing the plight of her fellow yazidis , who have fled hardline sunni militants of the islamic state during their onslaught in northern iraq
next in line to embrace abadi : nato .
in a statement just released ( h/t @ twitterid ) , nato secretary-general anders fogh rasmussen welcomes the nomination of abadi and calls for the swift formation of an inclusive government .
full statement : i welcome the decision by the iraqi president fouad massoum to nominate mr. haider al abadi as prime minister-designate of iraq .
this represents an important step in the constitutional process towards the formation of a new government .

i encourage the designated prime minister and all iraqi political leaders to work towards the swift formation of an inclusive government that represents the legitimate interests and aspirations of all iraqis .
forming such an inclusive government is essential in defeating the islamic state in iraq and the levant , which represents a threat to the security and stability of the region as a whole .
at this challenging time , nato remains committed to its partnership with iraq .
two car bombs killed 12 people in different parts of the iraqi capital baghdad on tuesday , police sources said , according to reuters .
a witness said he saw black smoke rising from the karada area of central baghdad .
an afp journalist tweets a photo : w.g .
dunlop ( @ wgdunlop ) smoke rises from the site of a bombing in the karrada area of central baghdad , iraq .

documents.title: iraqi kurdish leader said to back abadi
text: vice president joe biden has urged the most important kurdish political leader , massoud barzani , to work closely with abadi as he works to build a diverse , inclusive government representative of all iraqis .

this according to a white house description of a phone call between biden , president obama and barzani ( h/t @ twitterid ) , in which barzani also is said to have expressed his support for abadi : vice president joe biden called iraqi kurdistan regional president masoud barzani to discuss recent political and military developments in iraq .

the vice president discussed his and president obama 's monday calls with prime minister-designate haider al-abadi , and encouraged president barzani to work closely with dr. abadi as he works to build a diverse , inclusive government representative of all iraqis .

vice president biden also provided an update on the united states ' humanitarian assistance to refugees on sinjar mountain and the latest efforts by the u.s. military to help iraq security forces counter the threat posed by the islamic state of iraq and the levant .

president barzani expressed his support for the appointment of prime minister-designate haider al-abadi , and his willingness to work with abadi and other leaders to bring iraq 's different communities together to confront the nation 's political , economic , and security challenges .
president barzani thanked vice president biden for his call , and both leaders pledged to continue their regular communication .

just as the vatican issued a strong call to muslim leaders to denounce the persecution of christians and yazidis in iraq , egypt 's top religious authority condemned the armed group islamic state on tuesday .
in its statement tuesday , the vatican hinted that it is considering breaking off dialogue with islamic representatives if they fail to act .

guardian southern europe editor john hooper ( @ john hooper ) reports from rome : in a statement on tuesday , the department in charge of inter-religious dialogue said : the dramatic situation of the christians , the yazidis , and other minority religious and ethnic communities in iraq demands that religious leaders , and above all muslim religious leaders , people engaged in inter-religious dialogue and all people of good will take a clear and courageous stance .
all must be unanimous in their unambiguous condemnation of these crimes and denounce the invoking of religion to justify them .
read the full piece here .

meanwhile , the grand mufti shawqi allam , egypt 's most influential muslim cleric , described the so-called islamic state on tuesday as a corrupt , extremist organisation that is damaging islam , reuters reports : an extremist and bloody group such as this poses a danger to islam and muslims , tarnishing its image as well as shedding blood and spreading corruption , said allam , the state news agency mena reported .
the grand mufti 's view represents the opinion of al azhar , one of the world 's oldest seats of muslim learning , which influences the opinions of muslims worldwide .
read the full piece here .

documents.title: iran support for abadi did not happen 'overnight '
text: iran 's support for haider al-abadi , maliki 's designated replacement , was in place before tuesday 's announcement made it explicit , reports the guardian 's saeed kamali dehghan ( @ saeedkd ) : the head of iran 's supreme national security council , ali shamkhani , who is also a representative of the country 's supreme leader , ayatollah ali khamenei , has endorsed the procedure which led to abadi 's appointment , saying it was a legitimate act done in accordance with the iraqi constitution .
the islamic republic of iran supports the legal process for choosing the new iraqi prime minister , shamkhani was quoted on tuesday by the state irna news agency .
irna said shamkhani had congratulated al-abadi as well as iraq 's people and its religious community .

[ ] hossein rassam , a london-based iranian analyst , tells saeed that shamkhani 's views reflect tehran 's official position on al-abadi 's appointment : his appointment could not have materialise without iran 's cooperation , he told the guardian .
this is the result of a series of negotiations and bargaining for the past number of days , it 's not something that has been decided over the night .
according to rassam , iran 's top priority in iraq has been to avoid a power vaccum in baghdad as well as having a new prime minister close to tehran .
with abadi 's appointment , iran has achieved both , he said .

ali alizadeh , an iranian political analyst , tells saeed that iran 's welcoming of the new government and tacitly supporting the western governments is a correct pragmatic compromise : alizadeh told the guardian : it shows iran 's priority is to contain isis rather than wasting time to haggle over the amount of its influence on iraqi government .
saeed points out that iran 's explicit backing of abadi cinches an alignment of tehran and washington on the issue .

documents.title: us drone strikes isis position
text: an armed drone , likely a predator , hit an isis mortar position near mt sinjar , according to us central command , reports guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) : the drone strike , occurring around 7:55 eastern tuesday morning , brings us air attacks into their fifth day .
this is the third strike on isis positions near the mountain where the islamist army has besieged iraqi yazidis .
per centcom , the strike provided air cover to kurdish forces providing security for yazidis who were attempting to evacuate .
it destroyed the mortar position .
on monday , a us general , william mayville , told reporters that the military has yet to come up with a plan to get the yazidis off the mountain .
drones , as they so often do , amount to a stopgap .

documents.title: militias abandon maliki
text: guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) notes that the pentagon-connected institute for the study of war is tracking how iran and its iraqi militia proxies are turning their backs on maliki : the iranian-backed iraqi shi'a militia , asa'ib ahl al-haq ( aah ) decided to abandon support for maliki .
aah released an official statement to express its support for the decision made by the national alliance to appoint haider al-abadi for the premiership over nouri al-maliki .
there are also reports that hadi al-amiri , the head of the badr organization , will give a statement in support of abadi today .
a cor member from the badr bloc , razaq mhibis also stated his support for abadi .
statements by these two organizations strongly indicate the iranian attitude toward maliki and iraq 's government formation .
aah and the badr organization are not likely to make such statements without top cover from qassem suleimani and the iranian regime against maliki .
spencer : qassem suleimani , the chief of the qods force , is basically the iranian keyser soze .
he seems to be orchestrating maliki 's exit .

isw : qassem suleimani may first recommend a position for maliki in the new government , and then exercise an exit strategy for maliki in the midst of this contest that may reduce the potential for a maliki-directed mobilization in baghdad .
these actions do not remove the threat of violent clashes among shi'a groups and isf elements in baghdad that have taken opposing sides .
haider al-abadi will face a challenge to gain control over maliki 's baghdad security forces .
isis will likely take advantage of this contest , as indicated by such attacks in baghdad as the vbied and several other explosions reported in baghdad on august 11 .
maliki 's website confirms that he ordered his security forces not to intervene in the crisis .
in a brief statement it said : prime minister nouri al-maliki calls for security personnel to stay away from the political crisis and carry out their duties in protecting the country .
has maliki thrown in the towel ?
ap says he has ordered his security forces not to interfere in politics but to protect the nation .
it did not elaborate .
meanwhile , there is an unconfirmed report that iran could offer maliki asylum .
the news site al-araby quotes an unnamed official in baghdad claiming that maliki and his family have been offered protection in iran .
iraqis chant pro-government slogans and wave national flags to show support for maliki during a demonstration in baghdad on monday .
mizban/ap
the us is flying as many as 100 sorties over iraq each day , according to bloomberg , citing an official .
the figure includes reconnaissance and support missions as well as 15 targeted air strikes .
the flights have averaged 90 a day since 9 august , including as many as 30 by air force refuelling tankers , according to the official , who asked not to be identified discussing the data .
the sorties are mostly , but not exclusively , over northern iraq .

since 8 august us aircraft have been attacking mortar positions , mobile artillery , convoy vehicles and armoured personnel carriers under president barack obama 's authorisation for air strikes against the militant islamic state to protect religious minorities and american personnel in irbil , the seat of the kurdistan regional government .

here 's a summary of the main developments so far today : nouri al-maliki 's attempt to cling to power in iraq has suffered a major blow after his key regional ally , iran , backed prime minister designate haider al-abadi as his replacement .
a senior iranian official congratulated abadi and supported the process by which he was appointed .
maliki had claimed the appointment was unconstitutional .
the powerful badr organisation , an iranian-backed military group , also expressed support for abadi .
thousands of yazidis face potential genocide unless they get immediate help , a panel of un human rights experts has warned .
the un 's special rapporteur on minority issues , rita izsã¡k , said the danger of a massacre was imminent .
the british government is facing growing pressure to recall parliament to discuss the crisis in iraq .
the former lib dem leader sir ming campbell said parliament could be persuaded to back air strikes if a humanitarian case was made by ministers .
the british public narrowly backs the uk taking part in air strikes against jihadists in iraq , according to a yougov poll for the sun .
but it revealed the nation was split on the raf getting involved .

documents.title: ming campbell backs recall of parliament
text: the senior lib dem mp sir ming campbell has backed attempts to recall parliament to discuss the crisis in iraq .

speaking on bbc radio 4 's world at one programme , campbell said it would be in the government 's interests for parliament to discuss the matter and allow it to share with mps what it knows about the crisis .
campbell , a member of the commons intelligence and security committee , pointed out that minsters had not ruled out some form of military offensive in iraq .
the former lib dem leader said : we are already helping the americans by the provision of intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance .
and that 's why the introduction of the tornado gr4 is so important .
he added : i 'm not persuaded at the moment that the uk should join in air strikes along with the us .
but i think one has to keep an open mind about that because circumstances change very rapidly .
campbell said if parliament was recalled it could back air strikes despite the vote against intervention in syria last year .

i do n't know what the mood of the house of commons is , but if you were to argue that the justification for humanitarian intervention was paramount then parliament might be persuaded , but it would depend on the case made by ministers .

that 's why they should take the opportunity of making their case to the house of commons , so that not only will they be better informed about the mood of the house , but both parliament and the country will be better informed .
the us is offering the lure of more military and economic help to iraq if its new prime minister , haider al-abadi , can form an inclusive government .

speaking in sydney , the us secretary of state , john kerry , said : we are prepared to consider additional political , economic and security options as iraq 's government starts to build a new government .
the us defence secretary , chuck hagel , added that the us was prepared to consider further military support in iraq .
we would wait and see what future requests this new government will ask of us and we will consider it based on those requests , hagel said .
politically maliki is finished , according hayder al-khoei from chatham house , but he warned that the former prime minister could still be a destabilising force .
speaking to bbc news , khoei said both maliki 's rivals and his allies now wanted him to go .
but maliki has proven himself time and time again to be a survivor .
he is a very tough prime minister and we ca n't predict how he is going to react .
he can still cause a lot of problems for the political process and his rivals .
he is framing this is as an illegal , unconstitutional attempt to unseat him .
and he is being pushed into a corner .
khoei also warned that even if abadi succeeded in forming a unity government , iraq still faced a grim and fragmented future .
iraq as a nation state , as we have known it , is not going to return .
the best-case scenario is a much more decentralised country .
the worst-case scenario will be de facto partition , more civil war , more bloodshed and ethnic cleansing on a much wider scale .
iran has now gone as far as congratulating maliki 's successor , according to reuters citing iranian state tv .
the head of iran 's supreme national security council congratulated haider al-abadi for his nomination as the new iraqi prime minister , state-run al-alam television 's website reported .
iranian officials had said recently that iran believed maliki was no longer able to hold his country together and that it was looking for an alternative leader to combat a sunni islamist insurgency .

text: iran has tentatively backed abadi as iraq 's new prime minister , in what could be the most significant blow yet to maliki 's ambition of clinging to power .
iran , until now a key ally of maliki , said it backed the legal process to his replacement , afp reports citing iran 's fars news agency .
ali shamkhani , secretary and representative of supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei on iran 's supreme national security council , made the remarks at a meeting of iranian ambassadors in tehran .
hayder al-khoei , iraq expert at the chatham house thinktank , highlighted the significance of iran 's move .

nouri al-maliki is refusing to go quietly , according to reuters .
it said he had deployed militias and special forces on the streets , creating a dangerous political showdown in baghdad .

maliki said in a televised speech that the president 's decision to name a replacement for him was a dangerous violation of the constitution and , flanked by political allies , he vowed : we will fix the mistake .
maliki 's son-in-law , hussein al-maliki , called the move illegal and said it would be overturned in court .
we will not stay silent , he said .
the analyst kirk sowell pointed out that maliki 's militia had done nothing yet to stop the formation of a new government .

speaking after meeting iraq 's kurdish president , fouad massoum , fabius said : i know that in the west we are in the holiday period , but when there are people dying ¦ you have to come back from your holidays .

documents.title: un panel issues 'genocide ' warning
text: thousands of yazidis face potential genocide unless they get immediate help , a group of un human rights experts has warned .

the panel said it had received verified reports that islamic state militants were systematically hunting down members of minority groups who remained trapped in areas under their control and giving them an ultimatum to convert to islam or die .
the un 's special rapporteur on minority issues , rita izsã¡k , said the danger of massacre was imminent .

she said : all possible measures must be taken urgently to avoid a mass atrocity and potential genocide within days or hours civilians need to be protected on the ground and escorted out of situations of extreme peril .
the responsibility to protect populations at risk of atrocity crimes falls both on the iraqi government and the international community .

chaloka beyani , another member of the panel and the un 's special rapporteur on the human rights of internally displaced people , said : we are witnessing a tragedy of huge proportions unfolding in which thousands of people are at immediate risk of death by violence or by hunger and thirst .
a third member of the panel , christof heyns , special rapporteur on extrajudicial , summary or arbitrary executions , added : we can not stand by in the face of such atrocities .
international actors must do all in their power to support those on the ground with the capacity to protect lives .
thousands of yazidis , who were trapped on mount sinjar without food and water for days , arrive in haseki city , syria .

the tory mp mark pritchard said it was time for the uk to take direct military action and predicted a recalled commons would vote in favour of the escalation .
writing on the politicshome website , he said : the international community can pour as much aid into the region as it likes .
but unless islamic state fighters are killed and removed from the battlefield , they will go on killing and committing further atrocities .
the uk must not walk by on the other side and that is why overnight news that raf tornadoes are once again going to fly in iraqi airspace is welcome .
the un has suggested that military protection is necessary to save the lives of thousands of yazidi people pinned down by islamic state militants on the sinjar mountain .
speaking from irbil , kieran dwyer , chief spokesman for the un 's office for the coordination of humanitarian affairs , said thousands of people had escaped to relative safety .
but interviewed on bbc radio 4 's today programme he said the many thousands still trapped on the mountain represented the sharp edge of a major humanitarian crisis .
dwyer said they faced being killed by the militants or the hostile conditions unless a safe passage could be secured .
security is critical to getting access to these people , and getting urgent , life-saving humanitarian assistance to them , he said .
dwyer said it was very difficult to estimate the exact number of people trapped on the mountain .
there are still many thousands trapped and pinned down by these armed groups .
people are trapped on the mountain in multiple locations .
the mountain is about 100km in length and about 10km at its widest point .
it is a very large area .
those on the south side are much more exposed to the armed groups .

they are fearful of their lives from military attacks from these people in addition to the terrible condition on the mountain it is extremely exposed ¦ searing heat , 45c-plus and surviving is extremely difficult .

documents.title: second uk air drop
text: british forces have dropped a second round of aid to thousands of people trapped on the sinjar mountainside after fleeing islamic state militants .
the raf was able to deliver essential supplies to assist the yazidis , the department for international development ( dfid ) confirmed , pa reports .
the move follows an aborted attempt to deliver aid to the location in northern iraq , which was called off when the raf crew decided that the supplies could have injured the desperate people below .
a first successful aid drop took place last weekend .

the foreign secretary , philip hammond , who chaired a meeting of the government 's emergency cobra committee to discuss the crisis on monday , said the situation was challenging and warned of a potential humanitarian disaster on a huge scale .

dfid said the uk 's second aid drop included 3,180 reusable water purification containers filled with 15,900 litres of clean water and 816 solar lamps that could also be used to charge mobile phones .
the international development secretary , justine greening , said : the humanitarian situation in the iraq area is deeply worrying .
isis terrorists continue to contest towns and villages south of irbil and in the sinjar area and the yazidi community face appalling conditions , cut off on mount sinjar .
uk aid is already helping the people who desperately need it .
last night the raf successfully made a second drop of essential supplies , including 3,180 reusable containers filled with clean water .

members of the royal air force load humanitarian aid onto a hercules c130 transport plane at raf brize norton , northwest of london , on august 8 , 2014 to be airlifted to stranded civilians fleeing militants in northern iraq .

welcome to our live coverage of the continuing political , military and humanitarian crisis in iraq .

here 's a roundup of the latest developments : iraq 's embattled prime minister , nouri al-maliki , has been forced out of office after a rival shia politician , haider al-abadi , was asked to form a new government in an effort to end the deadlock that has paralysed the baghdad government while jihadists have swept through the country 's north .
maliki had seemed to be clinging to his post , but he was abandoned by party allies and sidelined by religious and regional backers who no longer believe he can save the crumbling state .
the us secretary of state , john kerry , urged abadi to quickly form an inclusive government , while ruling out sending us combat troops to the country .

we are urging him to form a new cabinet as swiftly as possible and the us stands ready to support a new and inclusive iraqi government and particularly its fight against isil [ islamic state ] , he said .
the us president , barack obama , welcomed the new leadership in iraq as a promising step forward .
obama did not mention maliki but called for iraqi political leaders to work peacefully through a political transition .
these have been difficult days in iraq , obama said .
american officials have denied participating in a plot to oust maliki , despite a series of phone calls made by obama and joe biden to support the appointment of his successor .

the daily beast alleged on monday that two senior us officials , the american ambassador to iraq , robert beecroft , and the deputy assistant secretary of state brett mcgurk , had been working to shore up abadi behind the scenes for the past month .

britain is deploying raf tornado jets to provide greater surveillance of northern iraq after being forced to abort two attempts to drop aid for yazidi refugees on mount sinjar because of fears that the cargo could have injured people on the ground .

amid growing calls for a recall of parliament to allow britain to join the us in launching air strikes against forces from islamic state ( isis ) , downing street announced an intensification of british involvement with the deployment of the tornadoes to the region .
the british public narrowly backs the uk taking part in air strikes against jihadists in iraq , according to a yougov poll for the sun .
but it revealed the nation was split on the raf getting involved .
of all the minorities ousted by the isis advance , the yazidis continue to pay the biggest price .

nearly all the yazidis the guardian met told stories of women and girls being kidnapped , or of men being killed in the brutal rampage that has shattered centuries of coexistence in iraq 's north-west .
a senior pentagon planning officer expects the current us air strikes in iraq to have minimal and fleeting impact on the forces of isis .

in the immediate areas where we have focused our strikes , we 've had a very temporary effect and we may have blunted some tactical decisions to move in those directions , further east to irbil , army lt gen william mayville told reporters .
abadi is a low-key figure who spent much of his life in exile in britain before returning to iraq after the 2003 invasion .
born in baghdad in 1952 , abadi joined the islamic dawa party maliki 's political bloc at the age of 15 .
his father , jawad al-abadi , was a prominent baghdad doctor and hospital director who became inspector general at the iraqi health ministry .
after the ba'athists seized power , abadi and his family came into conflict with the saddam hussein regime .
abadi studied electrical engineering in baghdad , and then in the late 1970s moved to britain to do a doctorate at manchester university .
